summary: The default `WorkerOptions.maxCachedWorkflows` value was significantly reduced in a recent change, causing a substantial decrease in workflow cache capacity (e.g., from 12600 to 761 on 64GB machines). The default needs to be increased to be more reasonable for typical deployments.
userImpact: Users experience significantly reduced workflow cache capacity by default, potentially impacting performance and causing unnecessary cache misses on adequately-sized machines.
rootCause: PR #802 reduced the default maxCachedWorkflows value without accounting for the impact on different machine sizes.
proposedFix: Increase the default maxCachedWorkflows value; potentially implement dynamic calculation based on available memory in the future.
resolutionDetails: Default maxCachedWorkflows value was increased to be more reasonable for typical deployments.
keyQuote: For example on a 64GB machine it went down from 12600 to 761 and on a 16GB machine (nightly CI) from 2853 to 261.
